translation.resume.narration:
Welcome back! Do you want to continue your story from where you last left 
        off?
translation.start.narration: Greetings, explorer. <break time='0.2s'/> Welcome to the Desert Traveler experience! <break time='0.2s'/> In this five-act interactive story, you can stop and come back at any time. Shall we start?
translation.Lost in Desert.narration: The blowing, hot wind scorches the surface of both the earth and your skin. You walk aimlessly in the desert, thirsty for water. <break time='0.5s'/> <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo/Heavy_footsteps_01.mp3'/> In the middle of the hot desert, you found a rusty, old signpost. It has two arrows pointing to the right and the left. However, the letters have faded away.
translation.Tutorial 1: Direction Questions.narratio: <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/>When you hear this sound, you will be deciding which path, or direction, to take. In this case, try saying: go to the left, or go to the right.
translation.Tutorial 1: Direction Questions.reprompt: You can say, look left or look right.
translation.Look Right.narration: You wiped your face with your dry hands and decided to turn right. Then, you keep treading the sea of powdered rocks wearily.
translation.Tutorial 1A: Check Around.narration: You walked under the hot sun until you have reached the top of a little sand hill. It grants you some height advantage. Now you can see what's around you. <break time='0.5s'/> Sometimes, paths aren't obvious at first glance just like now. You can check around first by saying what's around me. Go on, give it a go.
translation.Tutorial 1A: Check Around.reprompt: You can check around by saying "check what's around me".
translation.Tutorial 1A: Check Around.recap: You can check around by saying "check what's around me".
translation.Check Around the Hill.narration: You look around, like a compass slowly spinning. You don't find anything particularly interesting. <break time='0.5s'/> Wait! You see a few freckles on the yellow surfaces of Earth. It shines under the burning sun! You squint your eyes and look closer. <break time='0.5s'/> <emphasis level="reduced">It's a town!</emphasis> <break time='0.2s'/> There's a good chance that they have some water there.<audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/>

translation.Go to Town.narration: Quick! There might be water there.
translation.Town.narration: The urge of cold water passing through dry lungs has dragged your weary feet to the entrance of the town. You thought the townspeople would step forward immediately to help a thirsty traveler, but instead. <break time='0.2s'/> No-one came. What's happening? <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/> you can ask to check the environment. Try saying: "what's around me?"

translation.Around.narration: You're at the entrance of the town. Some small buildings align on the sides of the street. But all of their doors are shut tight. Only a few people are walking on the streets. It's almost as if they're trying to avoid having eye-contact with you.

He wears a red coat, and you can see surprised written all over his face. <break time='0.8s'/><voice name='Justin'> You are a new face here. Do you need help? <break time='0.2s'/> You don't look well.</voice> <break time='0.8s'/> Maybe the little boy has water. You can ask if there's water. <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/> When you hear this sound, you decide what to say to the other person next. For example, right now you can ask the boy for water. <break time='0.2s'/> Try it!

translation.Boy.narration:
You asked the boy for some water.  
		<voice name='Justin'>  
	    I can help you with that. <break time='0.2s'/> But I must warn you. <break time='0.2s'/> Situations in the house aren't exactly desirable. <break time='0.2s'/> In a sense.</voice> <break time='0.5s'/> 
		The boy takes you around the building and enters the store from the backdoor. <break time='0.5s'/> Oh dear. <break time='0.5s'/> It is far from being desirable. The air in the store is nothing of this world. It's foul and revolting. Each step you take is like a deeper dive into the bowels of a carnivorous beast. <break time='0.5s'/> 
		<voice name='Justin'> Yeah. Told you! <break time='0.5s'/> </voice>  
		<break time='0.5s'/> A bald, middle-aged man that looks like in his fifties are slowly walks down the stairs. <voice name='Justin'> Papa! <break time='0.5s'/> </voice> Small pieces of tissue paper are rolled and stuck in his nose. He looks like he could use some more sunshine.
translation.Shopkeeper.narration:
<voice name='Brian'> 
        Who is this person? <break time='0.5s'/> Why did you bring a stranger that looks like a dying cactus to this place? </voice>  
        <voice name='Justin'>  
        <break time='0.5s'/>Relax, papa. He's just a traveler. And he needs water. <break time='0.5s'/>A lot of water.</voice>  
        <voice name='Brian'>  
        Water? <break time='0.5s'/> Hah! I got lots of water. As if water would do anything to wash this stench away.</voice>  
        <break time='0.5s'/>  
        The young boy's father handed you a big glass of water.  
        <voice name='Brian'>  
        Hey. <break time='0.5s'/> Don't worry. I know it smells bad in here. But I assure you, the water is clean. <break time='0.5s'/> Go on, drink up. Ahh. Yes, the water is fresh and good.</voice> 
        <break time='0.5s'/> 
        Sometimes when appropriate, you can use an item, perform an action, or do nothing. For this instance, you can either say: <break time='0.2s'/> use water or do nothing.<audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/>

translation.Don't Drink.narration:
You hold the glass of water at your hand, but you don't drink from it. <break time='0.5s'/> 
    <voice name='Brian'> 
    <emphasis level="strong">Hmmmm.</emphasis> <break time='0.5s'/> </voice> 
    The shopkeeper looks at the glass of water. He looks down on the dusty floor. 
    <voice name='Brian'> 
    Suit yourself. Thought you were really thirsty. </voice> 
    <break time='0.8s'/> At least you're in the shade, so you're starting to feel a little bit less thirsty. But still, the stench is unbearable. 
    <voice name='Brian'> 
    Maybe the smell even went in the water, but we just don't know. <break time='0.8s'/> It wasn't like this before the incident. </voice> 
    <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/>
translation.Finding Out.narration:
The father has given you his word that the water is clean for drinking. But even without his promise you'd still chug the whole glass of water, bottoms-up. 
        <break time='0.5s'/> 
        The desert in your body is no more. Right now it is a lagoon of spring water, cool splashes of comfort travels to every corner of your body, like ice on melting lava. It's almost as if you could hear the hiss. 
        <voice name='Brian'> 
        Feel better? You really looked like the desert's going to get you.</voice>  
        Now it's just the stench that's really 
        giving you a headache. 
        <break time='0.5s'/> 
        <voice name='Brian'> 
        Sorry for the bad manners back there. It's just this town has never since a single visitor for a long time. Not after the incident.</voice> 
        <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/>You should ask him.

translation.Ask Shopkeeper.narration:
<voice name='Brian'>A while ago the town was famed for our Shawarma. People would come all the way from cities to this dune for a taste of it.<break time='0.5s'/>  

		</voice> 
		<audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/>
translation.Ask for Help.narration:
<voice name='Brian'>  

		<break time='0.5s'/> Anyway, this is a desert so you could imagine it never rains here <break time='0.2s'/> until that night. <break time='0.5s'/> On that night. We've seen the greatest thunderstorm of the town's history, <break time='0.2s'/> but no-one anticipated what came after.</voice> 
        <voice name='Justin'> 
        <break time='0.8s'/> And then the next morning, my dad started sweating like a cow. So did everyone else. </voice> 
        <voice name='Brian'> 
        Yeah. <break time='0.5s'/> What's worse was what happens afterward. <break time='0.2s'/>That's right.The stench. This stench. It kept everyone from talking to each other. It drove tourists away. And now, no-one wants to come to our town anymore.</voice> 
        <break time='0.5s'/> 
        The shopkeeper points to a poster on the left wall. It has some dust and the colors have started to fade away, but it's still pretty clear.  
        <voice name='Brian'> 
        The mayor believed that it's a curse from some spell caster. He was trying to find people to help. Even set up a great reward for anyone who lifts the curse.  
        <break time='0.5s'/> 
        Since you're here, why don't you help us? <break time='0.2s'/> There's a lucrative treasure, and it could be all yours. In the meantime, you can look around the store. No worries.</voice> 
        It seems like they really need your help. Do you want to help them?
translation.Ask for Help.reprompt: It seems like they really need your help.
translation.Ask for Help.recap: It seems like they really need your help. Do you want to help them?
translation.Mayor Office.narration: You've arrived at the mayor's office. It's the largest building in the town, but it's doors and windows are tightly shut and locked. <break time='0.2s'/> When you get close to the front door, there's a sharp smell of hot pepper. Looks like there's no way in. <break time='0.5s'/> If you don't know where to go, remember to say What's around me.

translation.Decide to Help.narration:
<voice name='Brian'> 
	    This is our lucky day, son. Finally a person who is willing to help us. Well, I guess I shouldn't be keeping you here for too long eh? </voice> 
		<voice name='Justin'>  
		But papa, you haven't told him anything about how to solve the problem. </voice> 
		<voice name='Brian'> 
		Oh yes, yes. hey, perhaps you can go ask if the mayor knows anything more. After all, he's the one who put up this poster. Maybe he knows more.</voice> 
		<voice name='Justin'>  
		But the mayor is also locking himself up. No one has seen him for a while. </voice> 
		<voice name='Brian'>  
		Ha! This, my son, is when being the owner of the ONLY general store in the town comes in handy <break time='0.2s'/> Kungh kungh, you see, the mayor has a secret craving for Super-Duper Hot Blue Pepper Sauce. <break time='0.2s'/> And guess who's selling it? Me! Ha haaah! </voice>

<voice name='Brian'>   
        One bottle of Super-Duper Hot Blue Pepper Sauce, coming right up! </voice>  
        <audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/findingThings1.mp3"/>  
        <voice name='Brian'>   
        Hmmm, where is it? </voice>  
        <audio src="https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/findingThings2.mp3"/>  
        <voice name='Justin'>   
        Dad, didn't you just sell one to Mrs. Chilirosa yesterday? </voice>  
        <voice name='Brian'>   
        Hmm, Oh yes, yes! I did sell one to her. <break time='0.2s'/> Oh dear. I guess that's our last bottle in a while. Next batch is not coming in a week, and I need to drive all the way out of town to get it because they can't stand our stench! </voice>  
        <voice name='Justin'>   
        Stop murmuring, dad. <break time='0.2s'/> Anyways, if you go ask Mrs. Chilirosa, she might still have some left for you.</voice>

        She's a stubborn old lady who works at the hair salon down the street. Like the mayor, she also has a craving for spicy things. </voice> 
        <voice name='Justin'>  
        Yeah! All my friends who visited her shop came out with hair that smelled spicy for days! </voice> 
        <voice name='Brian'>  
        But I know what she also likes. <break time='0.2s'/> As funny as it may sound, she also likes roses. But I doubt you'll be finding any of them around. Not in this desert.</voice>

translation.Shout At the Mayor_1.narration:
<voice name="Joey"> 
        Oh, thank you for bringing me the hot sauce. What brings you here?</voice> <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/>
translation.Shout At the Mayor_1.reprompt: Wait, you come here because you need more information on the smell. right?
translation.Shout At the Mayor_1.recap: You come here because you need more information on the smell. right?
translation.Mayor Talks More About the Incident.narr:
<voice name="Joey"> 
        Yes. There is a cave that we know to the Eastern valleys, but all we know is that the cave is guarded by puzzles and challenges. But what's beyond that nobody knows.you can ask about: the cave, puzzles, eastern valleys, the town, or leave to the cave</voice>
translation.Mayor Talks More About the Incident.repr: you can ask about: the cave, puzzles, eastern valleys, the town, or leave to the cave
translation.Ask Mayor the valleys.narration:
<voice name="Joey"> 
        The Eastern valleys is a long way from here. You better bring food and water. Or else you'll not make it.</voice>
translation.Ask Mayor Challenges.narration:
<voice name="Joey"> 
        We sent our best guys into the cave. <break time='0.2s'/> All they could remember when they returned was they were lost in a forest.</voice>
translation.Agree to Help the Mayor.narration:
<voice name="Joey">Wait. <break time='0.2s'/> Are you saying that you're willing to help us get rid of this disgusting smell? Oh please, sit down, sit down</voice> 
 
        You sit down on the old couch in the mayor's office. The couch releases a spicy smell that stings.   
       
    <voice name="Joey"> 
        So, the legend out there says there's a precious gem hidden in the valleys to the East, and that the precious gem is the key ingredient to lifting the curse.</voice> 

 
    <voice name="Joey">    that the don't know, is that the cavern is guarded by puzzles and challenges. But what's beyond that- nobody knows. Nobody remembers</voice>
translation.Ask the Mayor.narration: <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/>You can ask about how he knows all this, about the cave, or about the town itself.
translation.Ask the Mayor.recap: Well, the options are: A. ask about how he knows all this; B. ask about the cave; C. ask about the town it self.
translation.Ask Mayor How He knows.narration:
<voice name="Joey"> 
        A while ago we sent our best people to go and retrieve the stone. When they returned, they were covered in smell even nastier than what we have in the town. But what's worse was that they could barely remember anything. The doctor said that probably the smell was too unbearable that they passed out at some point and lost all the memory. This is all they could remember.</voice>
translation.Ask Mayor The Cave.narration:
<voice name="Joey"> 
        Strangely, some plant roots lead into the cave.</voice>
translation.Ask Mayor The Town.narration:
<voice name="Joey"> 
        The town has a story. I think it's the alchemist who did it.</voice>
translation.Continue Ask Mayor The Town.narration:
<voice name="Joey"> 
        Speaking of which, <break time='0.2s'/> this reminds me of a character, <break time='0.2s'/> yes, quite a character in our town. </voice> 
        The mayor pauses to sip a cup of water. He also spreads some of the hot sauce on his nose.  
        <voice name="Joey">  
        We had this guy who worked in one of the most famous Shawarma places in town. Everything was normal except he sweats a lot, and a lot. It's like he wasn't born for the desert. </voice> 
        The hot sauce made the mayor to sweat a little bit, as he tries to wipe of some of them from his cheeks. 
        <voice name="Joey"> 
        But it doesn't just stop there. Oh dear, he has this odor. It was offending the guests. A great embarrassment. </voice> 
        The mayor leans back and waves his hands while he talks.  
        <voice name="Joey"> So, in the end, we had to make him leave. That's just a story. I don't know if anyone has hired him again, but that was just some time before this smell found its way into the town. </voice>
translation.Before Leave For the Cave.narration: and you can also heave for the cave.<audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/>
translation.Before Leave For the Cave.recap: Well, the options are: A. leave for the cave; B. ask mayor about something else
translation.Leave the Cave.narration:
<voice name="Joey"> 
        I hope that these information are useful to you. We're all looking forward to seeing the town coming back to life some day. Good luck! </voice> 
        You leave the mayor's office, back on to the streets. The shopkeeper stands outside. 
        <voice name='Brian'> 
        are you leaving? bring some of these with you. If you're ready, the horse over there is ready for you; but if you are tired. take some rest. Would you like to leave or take some rest?</voice>
translation.Been Walking For Days.narration:
You've been walking for days, but still no sign of valleys, only desert. <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo/Heavy_footsteps_01.mp3'/> It's been a couple of days since you left the town. Although having a horse to carry you across the wilderness is fortunate, but now it seems very tired as well. <break time='0.5s'/> Your vision starts to get blurry again. Strangely, this blurriness seemed a bit, a bit yellow. You tried to muster your consciousness, only to find out that you're heading in to an inevitable sandstorm. As unwilling as you may be, this is the only way to the Eastern Valleys. You ride into the furious sandstorm. <break time='0.5s'/> 
		
		But soon, the sandstorm has devoured you into the yellow fog. The wind is so strong an unbearable that you couldn't go on anymore. You slowly close your eyes. 
		
		<voice name='Matthew'>
	    Wake up! Wake up! Don't fall asleep! </voice>
	    
	    A faint sound reaches your ear amidst the noise of the storm.
	    
	    <voice name='Matthew'>
	    We're getting out now, so don't fall on me! </voice>
        
        You feel like you were being carried onto a bed, so you close your eyes and let yourself drift away.
translation.Waking Up In An Empty Tent.narration: You wake up finding yourself in a tent. The sunlight sprinkles on your face through the small holes in the ceiling. As you slowly gain consciousness, you hear a strange noise coming from outside.
translation.Details of the Tent.narration: It's a tent with many vials and plants.
translation.Leave the Tent.narration: You're still in the desert. Beside the tent there is a mysterious plant wobbling around, and it's chewing a person. You can also hear someone yelling for help from the plant.
translation.utterance-check if there is anything I c: check if there is anything I can throw
translation.Look Around.narration: You looked around. But found nothing.
translation.Warning to Leave.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'> 
        I know why you're here, you need me! Don't leave me in this cowplant. </voice> 
        Are you sure you want to leave the man? Maybe we need to help him out.
translation.Examine the Thing.narration: It looks like a cow's head, but it has sharp teeth.
translation.Help the Person.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'> 
        Is someone there? <break time='0.2s'/> Thank God! You need to save me from this cowplant. </voice>
translation.MysMan Explains.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'> 
        You need to milk the cowplant. </voice>
translation.MysMan Introduces Himself.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
        my name is Luke, nothing but a humble merchant in the desert selling seeds and plants and other fascinating little gimmicks that be found nowhere else but in my awesome tent. </voice>
        
        Luke looks at the sun for a bit.
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        The sun sure is hot. Let's head back in to the tent first, shall we? </voice>
    
        Luke walks with you back into the tent.
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        Hmm. That wasn't very clever for you to travel through the sandstorm like that. You may have become a part of the desert, you know. </voice>
        
        As he enters the tent, he jumps into the center of tent, like a graceful dancer.
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        Welcome, to Luke's tent of peculiar collections. Would you be interested in any of the items I have? Would you be interested in a seed that grows nothing but more seeds? </voice>
        
        Don't forget, you need to get to the cave, fast. What should you ask?
translation.MysMan Introduces Himself 2.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
        This is a seed that grows more seeds. Would you like to know how it works? </voice>
        
        You can ask more about the plant, ask how to get to the cave. You can even simply leave.
translation.MysMan Introduces Himself 2.reprompt: You can ask more about the plant, ask how to get to the cave. You can even simply leave.
translation.utterance-how to get to the cave: how to get to the cave
translation.More About the Seed.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
		Ah, yes. This is a seed that makes more seeds. No plant roots, no flowers, just... seeds! I personally use it for seasoning. A great match for all dishes, even junk food. </voice>
		
		Luke eagerly waits for your response.
translation.MysMan Says Wait.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
        Wait <break time='0.2s'/> wait <break time='0.2s'/> wait!  What did I miss? </voice>
translation.Another Item.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
        Uh, how about this? This is a plant that glows in the day! </voice>
       
        He takes out a small flower that glows strongly in the tent. What will you ask?
translation.Another Item.reprompt: You can ask more about the plant, ask how to get to the cave. You can even simply leave.
translation.More About the Glowing Plant.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
		Ha! Glad that you've asked. This plant is a tremendous existence in our world. It glows when there's sunlight. If there is no sun, it doesn't glow! Ha! Isn't it fascinating? </voice>
translation.More About the Glowing Plant.reprompt: You can ask how to get to the cave. You can even simply leave.
translation.Next Item.narration:
Strangely, Luke starts to panic. He goes through all of his inventory, again and again. Then, he picks up a glass vial that was immediately in front of him before.
		
		<voice name='Matthew'>
        There! Found you. This, oh my dear, is a rare find out here in the desert. This, is a stinky plant. </voice>
        
        He seems really unsettled, but not because of the plant he's holding up to you. What will you ask?
translation.MysMan Says Stop.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
        Stop! Stop asking me how to get to the cave! Can you not see me trying to avoid your question? How can you be so stupid? </voice>

        As soon as the word stupid comes out of his mouth, he immediately knows that he said something that he shouldn't have.

        <voice name='Matthew'>
        I'm sorry. It's just that I've waited so long for someone to come and ask me about the cave. I'm sorry. </voice>
translation.MysMan Story.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
        It all happened a long time ago. Do you know why the town was cursed? </voice>
translation.MysMan Story Plot 1.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
        So you've heard what the townsfolk and the mayor had to say. Well, they never mentioned to you about me, did they? </voice> 
        
        Luke looks away into the holes in the tent.
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        They say that it was the alchemist that was responsible for the curse. First of all, it wasn't a curse. It's merely an experiment gone wrong. We were trying to transform the smell of the stinky plant into something enjoyable. But instead, it went wrong. </voice>
        
        Luke picks up the bottle with the stinky plant sealed within, and stares into it.
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        The failed potion accidentally went into the soil and contaminated the land. That's how the stench got to everyone.
        
        He sighs and puts down the bottle.
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        But that wasn't all. I wasn't thinking properly. I knew that the townsfolk will be angry at us, and I was afraid. I wasn't prepared to take the blame, so I went out and told the townsfolk all about it. I told that it was the alchemist's fault. I thought that would make me feel safer from the anger of these people. </voice>
        
        The wind blows a little bit outside the tent. Luke holds his hands together and covers his face.
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        The next thing I know was that when I came back, the alchemist was being yelled at, and banished from the town. 
        
        He breathes sharply, as if he's trying to get himself together.
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        Well. I left the town soon after. Looking at his old place every day like that, it's just not possible. </voice>
        
        Luke musters his strength and stands up, then look back at you.
translation.Luke Explains the Cave.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
        The cave is guarded by a thick forest. You're probably wondering how a forest could grow in the middle of the desert. Well, the alchemist is an expert in botany. His knowledge allows him to grow anything anywhere, even in the desert. </voice>
        

        Luke goes through his shelf of specimens for a second, and returns with a compass, a small bottle of potion, and a vial of a small, but beautiful flower. Carefully, he uncovers the vial.
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        Anyways, the forest is a maze. If you make the wrong turn, you'll get lost. This is where the leading flower comes in to play. </voice>
        
        He holds up the flower.
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        This flower tells directions. As long as you give it a clear destination, it will lead you to it accurately and timely. Here, hold these two for me, will you? </voice>
        
        Luke then hands over the flower and the compass to you. Suddenly, with an exaggerating pose, Luke throws the potion into the air. But instead, the potion only traveled for a second or two before it landed. The potion breaks. Magically, a garden surrounded by bushes appears in the middle of nothing.
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        Now. You will use this flower and guide yourself to garden, which is in the center of this maze. First, say to the flower <break time='0.5s'/> "Lead me to the garden." </voice>
        
        The flower suddenly stands up straight, like it has awoken from some sleep.
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        Good. Then, grab some dust from the ground and sprinkle it on the flower. You use the dust on the leading flower. </voice>
        The flower gently shakes for a second. 
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        Great. That means the flower has locked on to the scent of a garden, and knows how to get to it now. Hold the flower and look at four directions: East, South, West, and North. </voice>
translation.MysMan Story Plot 2.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
        So you've heard what the townsfolk and the mayor had to say. Well, they never mentioned to you about me, did they? </voice>
        
        Luke away into the holes in the ceiling. 
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        They say that it was the alchemist who was responsible for the incident. And they were right, except for one spot: I was beside him when it took place. </voice>
        
        Luke strokes his chin for a bit.
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        It was merely an accident. We were experimenting with the stinky plant and see if its unbearable smell can become an extraordinary perfume. </voice>
        
        Luke picks up the bottle with the plant sealed in.
        

        <voice name='Matthew'>
        I knew that it was going to fail, but he disagreed. We had a big fight, and I left the lab for the night. The next thing I know, is that the town was flooded with the flower's smell, and the townsfolk were angry at the alchemist. In the end, they drove him away. </voice>

        Luke pauses for a while, as if he was trying to talk to himself in his head.

        <voice name='Matthew'>
        If I had been there to stop him, none of this would've happened. It was my fault. </voice>

        Luke then puts the plant back on the table.
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        I know why you're here. You came from the town, didn't you? You're here for the cave, where the alchemist resides. I can tell you about the puzzles in the cave.
translation.One Last Thing.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
		That's pretty much it. Oh. Wait. </voice>

		Luke goes to a locked chest and retrieves a purple seed.

		<voice name='Matthew'>
		There's another thing about the citrine that you're looking for. The antidote cannot be made without this other ingredient. He probably doesn't know this yet, since he has never left the cave. </voice>

		Luke hands the seed to you.
		
		<voice name='Matthew'>
		Here, take it. After all I've done to him, I don't think I'm ready to confront him yet. Bring this seed to him for me. </voice>
		
		Luke walks to the entrance and sticks his head out.

		<voice name='Matthew'>
		The day is not young. You must go before the sandstorm comes and catch you again. Or if you want to, you can stay here for a while to wait for the storm to leave. </voice>

		You can pause your journey and take some rest here, or you can continue and hurry to the cave. Would you like to leave for the cave?
translation.One Last Thing.reprompt: Luke has handed you a purple seed that is crucial to producing the antidote. Now you may choose to pause your journey and take some rest here, or you may leave and continue to the cave. Would you like to leave for the cave?
translation.One Last Thing.recap: You may choose to pause, or leave and continue to the cave. Would you like to leave for the cave?
translation.End of ACT III, 1&2.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
		Very well then. Keep riding to the East. The valley is close. Follow the plant roots and you will reach the cave eventually. </voice>

		Both of you walk slowly outside the tent. It looks like Luke has something to tell you, but he's trying to keep it to himself.

		<voice name='Matthew'>
		Hey, </voice>

		As you make yourself comfortable on the saddle, Luke calls you.

		<voice name='Matthew'> 
		When you do meet the alchemist, tell him I'm sorry, will you? </voice>

		He then gives your horse a big slap. The horse charges into the East, leaving Luke behind in the desert.
translation.MysMan Says Wait I Know.narration:
Just as you're about to leave, Luke grabs your hand and stops you from leaving.

        <voice name='Matthew'>
        Wait! Stop! You can't leave. If you leave, you won't make it to the cave. </voice>
        
        He looks at you with determined eyes.

        <voice name='Matthew'>
        Yes. I know why you're here. You're here because you need to get to the cave. You're here because you needed the citrine to lift the curse. And I'm the only one who knows how. </voice>

        How did he know that you're going to the cave? And what does he know about it? You may want to ask him.
translation.MysMan Says Wait I Know.reprompt: Luke seems to know that you're going to the cave, and he knows something about it. You may want ask him.
translation.Luke Explains How He Knows.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
        When I first met you, you still had that stinky smell that I could recognize anywhere. You came from the West, and there's only one reason for anyone to travel this far in the desert for a cave they've never heard before. I know all of this, because I was a part of the story. </voice>
translation.Luke Explains Plot 3.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
        I learned from the townsfolk that the curse was caused by an alchemist. I am also an alchemist, hence all these vials and bottles I carry; but any alchemist would know that a curse is not something that we would do. </voice>
        
        Luke let's go of your hand. 
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        Oh, I'm sorry. Anyways, as a fellow alchemist, I've been searching for ingredients that might help alleviate the situation. From time to time I've traveled back to the town and asked for any clues or information about the alchemist. </voice>
        
        Luke then goes through the piles of notes on the ground and retrieves a black little book.
        
        <voice name='Matthew'>
        From the information I gathered regarding the alchemist, the cave and what-not, I think I have a good guess on a challenge that lies in the cave.
translation.Luke Explains Plot 3.reprompt: Luke reveals that he is also an alchemist, volunteered to help with the cause whenever he can. He also knows what challenge is in the cave, which you might want to ask?
translation.Luke Explains Plot 3.recap: Luke looks confused and didn't understand. You might want to ask about the challenge in the cave.
translation.Luke Explains Why He Can't Go plot 3.nar:
<voice name='Matthew'>
        I wanted to go, but I have my own business to look after. Living in the desert is not something particularly easy, you know? On the other hand, you are going, and I can tell you about the challenges, so let's get to it?</voice> <break time='0.5s'/>
translation.One More Thing Plot 3.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
        Oh, by the way. </voice>
        
        Luke goes to an old wooden chest and takes out a purple seed.

        <voice name='Matthew'>
        This is what you'll need for the antidote. It's called the Eureka seed. The townsfolk may have told you that the citrine is the key ingredient, but they were only half-right. Only combining the citrine and the Eureka seed can one brew a successful antidote. Take it with you. </voice>
        
        Luke walks to the entrance and sticks his head out.

        <voice name='Matthew'>
        The day is not young. You must go before the sandstorm comes and catch you again. Or if you want to, you can stay here for a while to wait for the storm to leave. </voice>
        
        You can pause your journey and take some rest here, or you can continue and hurry to the cave. Would you like to leave for the cave?

translation.End of ACT III, 3.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
		Very well then. Keep riding to the East. The valley is close. Follow the plant roots and you will reach the cave eventually. Both of you walk slowly outside the tent. </voice>
		
		It looks like Luke has something to tell you, but he's trying to keep it to himself.
		
		<voice name='Matthew'>
		Hey! </voice>
		
		As you make yourself comfortable on the saddle, Luke calls you.

		<voice name='Matthew'>
		If you do meet the alchemist in the end, I would imagine that he demanded the name of this seed. You know, alchemists are all alike, can't trust anything unless they know what it is. Make sure you tell him the name, won't you? </voice>
		
		He then gives your horse a big slap. The horse charges into the East, leaving Luke behind in the desert.
translation.MysMan Spills the Tea.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
		Yes, this stinky plant emits a funny and unsettling smell. So unsettling that it can <break time='0.5s'/> it can <break time='0.5s'/> pollute the water. </voice>



		Luke silences for a long 3 seconds. All you can hear is the wind and the tent flapping in the wind. He doesn't look right. Is he ok?
translation.Mysman Tells the Story Plot 4.narration:
<voice name='Matthew'>
		It's nothing. </voice>

		Luke smirks a bit.

		<voice name='Matthew'>
		Some time ago, a friend of mine was experimenting with this plant. </voice>
		
		Luke points to the vial of stinky plant.

		<voice name='Matthew'>
		He believes that he can turn this unpleasant smell into something lovable and out of this world. But he failed, very hard. The scent became so bad that he had to abandon his lab. </voice>
		
		Luke looks to the ground for a bit, then turns away from you.

		<voice name='Matthew'>
		That's the last time I heard from him. 


		Before you could ask any questions, he presses on with the conversation.

		<voice name='Matthew'>
		You, on the other hand. <break time='0.5s'/> I know what you want. Yes. You want to go to the cave, don't you? Some town in the west needs your help. I've heard travelers here and there trying to get into the cave, and I've seen it myself too. I know that a challenge awaits you in the cave.
translation.Mysman Tells the Story Plot 4.reprompt: Luke tells you that the stinky plant reminded him of a friend who experimented with it, but ended up miserably. Then, he mentions a challenge that awaits you in the cave. You may want to ask him more on that.
translation.Mysman Tells the Story Plot 4.recap: Luke squints his eyes and puts his ears closer to you, like he didn't understand. You might want to ask him more about the challenge?

translation.Luke Explains Why He Can't Go plot 4.nar:
<voice name='Matthew'>
        Why I can't go? Well, as you can see how I ended up with that cowplant out there, I'm not the physical type. </voice>

<voice name='Matthew'>
		Oh, almost forgot. </voice>

		Luke heads under his bed and pulls out an old chest. In it he takes out a vial that contains a purple seed.

		<voice name='Matthew'>
		I've been also researching on how to get rid of this mess. It seems like besides the Citrine, you would also need this seed to make the antidote. </voice>
		
		Luke hands over the vial to you.
		
		<voice name='Matthew'>
		This is the Eureka seed. Take it with you. You'll need it. </voice>

		Luke walks to the entrance and sticks his head out.
		
		<voice name='Matthew'>
		The day is not young. You must go before the sandstorm comes and catch you again. Or if you want to, you can stay here for a while to wait for the storm to leave. </voice>

		You can pause your journey and take some rest here, or you can continue and hurry to the cave. Would you like to leave for the cave?

translation.Arrival At The Inner Cave.narration:
You see the oasis, and a floating gem in the middle. It's the citrine. You see an old man looking at you. 
        <voice name='Russell'> 
        Oh my, o my o my omy, the first person to visit my glorious palace in the deep caverns. You must be really tired, aren't you?</voice> <break time='4s'/>
translation.Alchemist Grabs You.narration:
<voice name='Russell'>  
        You must excuse my attitude, but I must show you the way to my hut, where you will get some rest while I finish up stuff out here. </voice> 
 
        He grabs you firmly on the arm and you both quickly enter the hut. He sits you on a tiny little chair, then quickly exits the room. 
 
        <voice name='Russell'>  
        Just wait for a second, will you? </voice> 
 
        He shuts the door.
translation.Exit The Room.narration:
<voice name='Russell'>  
        AH! </voice> 
 
        You find the alchemist in your face. He is scared as you suddenly open the door. 
 
        <voice name='Russell'>  
        Sorry, it's been a long time since I've seen anyone else. You're the first one to enter the cave, and I don't know how to act, so I locked you in. I'm working on the last step to my latest work, care to join? </voice>
translation.Join The Alchemist At the Cauldron.narra:
<voice name='Russell'>  
        Here we go! </voice> 
 
        The cauldron explodes. Nothing was made. It was a failure. The alchemist looks at you and cries 
 
        <voice name='Russell'> Why? I thought I had everything right. I was supposed to be ready on the day you arrive. What ingredient am I missing? </voice>
translation.Alchemist Asks Again.narration: Are you sure? You might get something that you seek.
translation.Alchemist Teel You to Stay Here.narratio:
<voice name='Russell'> 
        Oh well, I guess that you're just afraid of explosions. It's ok. Just stay here and watch.</voice>
translation.Alchemist Performs At the Cauldron And F:
<voice name='Russell'>  
        Here we go! </voice> 
 
        The cauldron explodes. Nothing was made. It was a failure. The alchemist looks at you and cries 
 
        <voice name='Russell'> Why? I thought I had everything right. I was supposed to be ready on the day you arrive. What ingredient am I missing? </voice>
translation.Alchemist Asks.narration:
<voice name='Russell'>  
        Wait, who gave you this seed?</voice>
translation.Alchemist Questions About Luke.narration:
<voice name='Russell'> 
        What? Luke sent you this seed? <voice name='Matthew'> SENT YOU THIS SEED? Oh, now he knows how to be an apprentice? To not stab his master in the back? Did he tell you about what happened? </voice>
translation.Alchemist Continues to Scold Luke.narrat:
<voice name='Russell'>  
        So you know, right? Unbelievable. What else did he say?</voice>
translation.Alchemist Scolds Luke Thrice.narration:
<voice name='Russell'>  
        Hmph. This Mandrake, well he ought to give it to me. Now, let me end this curse, come with me. </voice>
translation.Alchemist Scolds Luke For His Weird Beha:
<voice name='Russell'>  
        What? That doesn't sound like what he would have said. Anyways, I deserve this Mandrake. I will end this crisis once and for all. </voice>
translation.Alchemist Sits Down.narration:
<voice name='Russell'>  
        Oh. </voice> 
 
        He goes back to the hut and looks at his photo with Luke. 
 
        <voice name='Russell'>  
        After all this time, huh? You know, we used to be partners. I mean, he is still an apprentice to me, but we act like partners. We used to say to each other Eureka! When we succeeded on our experiment. You said this seed was from him? </voice>
translation.Alchemist Accepts.narration:
<voice name='Russell'>  
        Oh pal. How long have I waited you. Come, let's finish this potion and end this curse once and for all. </voice>
translation.Alchemist Smirks And Accepts.narration:
<voice name='Russell'> 
        Ha. This has to be him. Let's finish this once and for all, shall we? </voice>
translation.None of It Matters Anyway.narration:
<voice name='Russell'>  
        So what, did he say anything? </voice>
translation.Alchemist Questions About the Seed.narra:
<voice name='Russell'>  
        Do you even know what this seed is? This seed is called the Glimmerbrook Mandrake, and is impossible to come by anywhere around. This person you meet, must be also a great alchemist and botanist. Hard to find this thing around here. Come, let's see if this works. </voice>
translation.Alchemist Asks More.narration:
<voice name='Russell'>  
        What? This is called Eureka? Did the guy who gave you this told you that it's called Eureka? </voice>
translation.Alchemist Realizes.narration:
<voice name='Russell'>  
        Oh. </voice> 
 
        The alchemist pauses for a second. 
 
        <voice name='Russell'> Oh, partner. Why don't you just come to me directly? Well, my partner back in the day and I used to use this word a lot when we made progress. And I know it was him that you met, because this plant is not called Eureka, but a Glimmerbrook Mandrake. If he gave this to you, it means that this is the ingredient I'm missing. Come, let's finish this. </voice>
translation.Alchemist Smirks.narration:
<voice name='Russell'> 
        Ha. It's funny because Eureka is a word that I use a lot with my old friend back in the day. Well, until that night when the incident happened. Could be just a happy accident, though. This seed is not called Eureka, but Glimmerbrook Mandrake. This person you meet, must be also a great alchemist and botanist. Hard to find this thing around here. Come, let's see if this works. </voice>
translation.Alchemist Brews Potion.narration:
<voice name='Russell'>  
        Let's do this.</voice> 
 
        He brews the potion. Suddenly the skies are filled with dark clouds, then it starts pouring rain. But it was not stinky rain. Conversely, it washes away the stench. 
 
        <voice name='Russell'>  
        Eureka! Quick. We must bring back this potion the town instantly. </voice>
translation.Return Back To Town.narration: The alchemist returns and apologizes everyone, and fixes the town.

translation.cowplant_puzzle_start.narration: You wake up finding yourself in a tent. The sunlight sprinkles on your face through the small holes in the ceiling. As you slowly gain consciousness, you hear a strange shouting coming from outside. But before you get the sound, it's strange enough that you ended up in this tent. What's inside this tent?
translation.cowplant_puzzle_tent_around_tutorial.nar: Surprisingly, it's a fairly large tent, and a messy one. Books and papers are scattered everywhere on the floor. There is also a cabinet full of plants and seeds and mysterious materials contained in vials and glass jars. A leather book that reads Cowplant Observation Notes is present on the small table beside it. That's pretty much it in the tent, but what's outside?
As you exit the tent, you see the familiar, infinite desert. Oh. You're still in the desert. As you look back at the tent, you immediately noticed a strange plant. This plant is the size of a big refrigerator, and it has a mouth. That's right, a mouth. A man is lying on the ground, fainted.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_outside_interaction.repr: You can view different things, look around, or go to the tent. <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/>

translation.cowplant_puzzle_tent_view_man.narration: You view the man. He is sitting in front of the table. Looking at nowhere. His eyes are out of focus. You should ask what happened. <audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/>
translation.cowplant_puzzle_tent_view_man_talk.narra: He is muttering no sense words. You probably need to figure out what happened to him by yourself. And hopefully you can find how to cure him. Possiblly from the notebook?
translation.cowplant_puzzle_tent_around_noman.narrat: You are in a messy tent. A leather book that reads Cowplant Observation Notes is present on the small table.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_tent_around_man.narratio: You are in a messy tent. A man is sitting in front of a  small table. A leather book that reads Cowplant Observation Notes is present on it. Behind you, it's the door.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_outside_stereo_on.narrat: You turn on the stereo. Oh, my, god. The plant is swagging along the music.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_outside_view_stereo.narr:
You view the stereo. It is placed on the ground beside the plant. Looks like someone listens to it frequently.
 You can turn on the stereo.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_outside_view_basket.narr: You view the basket of swordfish on the corner. It seems like someone is feeding this creature by swordfish. You can probably interact with the plant, to feed it.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_cowplant_interaction.rep: You an do anything to the cowplant, or you can leave. If you don't know what to do to it, you should probably leave to explore more and come back later.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_cowplant_interaction.rec: If you don't know what to do to it, you should probably leave and come back later.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_outside_view_plant.narra: You view the plant. It is a bizarre plant.  It has a cow head but roots of plants. A bell is hanging on its stem, or, you should say, neck. Staring closer at the plant, a tinny label is taped on, reads, cow-plant. It is waving as it is attracting your attention. It sticks out its tongue to you, and the weirdest thing is, the tongue is a cake! You can do anything to the cowplant by saying, interact with the plant. If you don't know what to do to the plant, you should probably go look around first.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_outside_wake_man.narrati: You wake up the man. He stares at you for a second and walks straight to the tent. He is muttering some nosense words. You wonder if he is the one who saved you from the sandstorm, and what damaged his mind. You can probably go to the tent to discover more, or you can view other things.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_outside_view_man.narrati: You view the man. He is fainted, and lying on the ground. He is wet and smelly. Some sort of liquid sticks on all of his body. You can wake up the man.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_outside_around_man.narra: You look around. You are outside. Looking at far away, you can only see the infinite desert. In front of you, there is a tent, and a plant. A man is lying on the ground. Besides the plant, there is a basket of swordfish, and a stereo.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_outside_around_noman.nar: You look around. You are outside. Looking at far away, you can only see the infinite desert. In front of you, there is a tent, and a plant. Besides the plant, there is a basket of swordfish, and a stereo.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_tent_getmilk.narration: You go to the tent. The man is still stumbled. You forced him to drink the milk. <voice name='Matthew'>Ahhh... What is that! en... Thanks. You bring me back!</voice>
translation.cowplant_puzzle_plant_milk.narration: You milk the plant, and get a bottle of potion. That's it! That is the potion which can heal the man.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_plant_cake.narration: You go for the cake but then you find that grabing its cake tongue is too disgusting to do.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_plant_play.narration: You play with the cowplant. It seems happy.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_plant_feed.narration: You picked up a swordfish from the basket and feed the plant with it. It sticks its tongue back.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_grab_notebook.narration: You open the notebook. You wonder what cowplant is. So, you find the bookmark that reads, Introduction, and you flip the notebook to that page. It reads. Cowplant is a bizarre, partly bovine form of vegetation. It usually has 4 growth states. You can search for any keyword that you found from the previous pages. For example, try to say, search growth states.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader.repr: What keyword do you want to search? You can search for any keyword that you found from the previous pages. Or you can close the notebook if you are finish searching.<audio src='https://koetest.s3.amazonaws.com/new_demo_stereo/action_question.mp3'/>
translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader_devo: You searched the keyword, devour, and opened up the notebook from that bookmark. If a person attempts to take the cake again, the cowplant will devour them. Which means, they are killed forever.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader_deme: You searched the keyword, severe dementia, and opened up the notebook from that bookmark. It reads. Allergic to cowplant can possiblly cause severe dementia to certain people. Syptoms include eyes out of focus, memery lost, and loss of ability to speak. Drinking the cowplant milk will release the bad mood, as the same time, cure the allergic symtoms.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader_alle: You searched the keyword, allergic symtoms, and opened up the notebook from that bookmark. It reads. A few people are allergic to be swallowed by the cowplant. Allergic symtoms are different from person to person. Possiblly causing severe dementia to certain people.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader_spro:
You searched the keyword, sprout, and opened up the notebook from that bookmark. It reads.
 When you plant a Cowplant Berry, there are tiny horns appearing through the soil.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader_berr: You searched the keyword, cowplant berry, and opened up the notebook from that bookmark. It reads. Cowplant berry is a black and white berry. Once you plant the cowplant berry into the soil, it will gow up as a sprout stage cowplant.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader_hung:
You searched the keyword, hungry, and opened up the notebook from that bookmark. It reads.
When cowplant is hungry, it will stick its cake tongue out. You can feed them at this moment. Cowplant will swallow whoever go for the cake.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader_deat: You searched the keyword, death state, and opened up the notebook from that bookmark. It reads. Twelve hours after a Cowplant shows its cake tongue, and is not fed, it will die, A dead Cowplant has a dead stem with a hanging Cowplant skull. Cowplants cannot be saved after this stage.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader_milk: You searched the keyword, milk, and opened up the notebook from that bookmark. It reads. If people were swallowed for the first time, the cowplant will produce milk. Milking a cowplant, you will get a potion to release the mood, and give the emotions back to the patient. The study found, drinking the milk can also cure the allergic symptoms.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader_swal:
You search the bookmark that writes, swallow, and opened up from that page. It reads.
When a person is swallowed for the first time, the Cowplant will spit them out, and they will recieve a drained mood, which will last two days. The mood
will make people feels like an emotionless shell. Different allergic symptoms causing by swallowed have been found to a few people. If attempt to go for the cake again, the cowplant will devour them. But, if people survive from the first swallowing, the cowplant will produce milk.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader_cake: You searched the keyword, cake tongue, and opened up the notebook from that bookmark. It reads. Cowplant has a cake shaped tongue. When it is hungry, it will stick its tongue out to attract people's attention, so cowplant can swallow them.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader_feed: You searched the keyword, feed, and opened up the notebook from that bookmark. It reads. A Cowplant can  be fed  by meat when its hungry and its cake- shape- tongue sticks out.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader_stat: You searched the keyword, growth states, and opened up the notebook from that bookmark. It reads. Cowplants usually have three growth states, and can die. They are sprout state, baby state, mature state, and death state.

You searched the keyword, growth states, and opened up the notebook from that bookmark. It reads. Cowplants usually have three growth states, and can die. They are sprout state, baby state, mature state, and death state. To finish searching, you should close the notebook.

translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader_matu: You searched the keyword, mature state, and opened up the notebook from that bookmark. It reads. In this stage, the Cowplant is fully matured. You can feed it, or at certain moment, you can milk it.
translation.cowplant_puzzle_notebook_seedtrader_baby: You searched the keyword, baby state, and opened up the notebook from that bookmark. It reads. A few days after you plant the cowplant berry. You can see a tiny cowplant. In this state, you can't do much things with it.
